text: Maurice B. Brennan (April 6, 1842 - August 7, 1927) was an American politician and farmer. Born in County Kerry, Ireland, Brennan emigrated with his parents to the United States in 1848, initially settling in Springfield, Massachusetts. In 1852, Brennan and his family settled in the town of Morrison, Brown County, Wisconsin. Brennan was a livestock dealer and farmer. Brennan served as assessor of the town of Morrison. In 1881 and 1905, Brennan served in the Wisconsin State Assembly as a Republican. Brennan died at the home of his daughter in Cato, Manitowoc County, Wisconsin, where he had been living.Wisconsin Blue Book 1905, Biographical Sketch of Maurice B. Brennan, p. 1089. ==Notes== Category:1842 births Category:1927 deaths Category:Irish emigrants to the United States (before 1923) Category:People from Morrison, Wisconsin Category:People from Cato, Wisconsin Category:Farmers from Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly
title: Maurice B. Brennan
